item.title: Are there any Floridians still on 'Bachelor in Paradise' this season?
item.description: "Bachelor in Paradise"is back after a year-long hiatus, followingformer Bachelor Nation contestantsas they attempt a second (or third, or fourth) chance at finding their soulmate on national television.

item.title: Florida law could allow WSJ to 'SLAPP' Donald Trump with attorney fees
item.description: A lawcentral to First Amendment protections in Florida may apply in a federal lawsuit fromPresident Donald Trumpagainst theWall Street Journal, which came after a report about a birthday letter from Trump to convicted sex offenderJeffrey Epstein.

item.title: How many people were busted under new "super speeder"…
item.description: In just under a month, the Florida Highway Patrol has busted at least 26 "super speeders" under anew, harsher speeding lawthat adds arrests, hefty fines and even jail time for anyone going 50 mph over the limit or over 100 mph.

item.title: Plan to decrease speed of tractor trailers on Florida…
item.description: Some more changes are ahead when it comes to sharing the highway and parking lots with drivers of big trucks.

item.title: Trump accused of cheating in golf (again) after viral…
item.description: Longstanding accusations of PresidentDonald Trumpcheating at golf have resurfaced after a video of him inScotland over the weekendwent viral.

item.title: Florida spiny lobster season is almost here! See dates…
item.description: Get ready for48 hours of lobster-snaring madnessthis week.

item.title: Florida federal judge wants reason to keep Haiti…
item.description: After a Texas-based company that helped evacuate people fromwar-torn Haitiin 2024 sued the state of Florida for nonpayment, a federal judge in Tallahassee wants to know why the case shouldn't be thrown out.

item.title: VOTE for Sarasota-Manatee's all-time best state championship football team
item.description: The Herald-Tribune has gone back and documented the area football teams that have won state championships.
